title: 3 people injured in S.E. Portland shooting
content:
Three people were injured late Saturday in a shooting in Southeast Portland.
Officers responded to the scene at Southeast 162nd Avenue and Stark Street about 10:40 p.m. They found one victim, who was taken to a Portland hospital. While police were investigating, two other people arrived at an emergency department with gunshot wounds. None had injuries that were life threatening, police said.
Witnesses said the shooting was connected to an event at the Rosewood Initiative Community Center, located at 16126 S.E. Stark St.
No one has been arrested. Police said they've been unable to track down much information about the reason behind the shooting or who the suspect or suspects might be. Nevertheless, they urged anyone who left the scene without talking to police to call the non-emergency line at 03-823-3333.
-- Lynne Terry
@LynnePDX
